oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Soloists: Artur Rubinstein (Piano). Works by: Tchaikovsky, Tchaikovsky, Tchaikovsky, and Unspecified. Notes: All Tchaikovsky program

Program originally scheduled for June 17, 1943, and postponed due to rain.

At the start of this 26th season, "a new stage was dedicated, with the help not only of the concert but of Mayor La Guardia and Sam A. Lewisohn, honorary chaimen of Stadium Concerts, Inc." (NYTimes June 19, 1943)

Mayor Fiorello H. La Guardia helped to dedicate the new stage... and paid his prespects to the city's department stores and to 'the lousy politicians.'" (NY Times June 19, 1943)

Rubinstien encores by Chopin, Prokofiev and De Falla

oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: New York Philharmonic Leon Levy Digital Archives
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Soloists: Irina Baronova (Dancer), Andre Eglevsky (Dancer), Kathryn Lee (Dancer), Anna Istomina (Dancer), Leonide Massine (Dancer), and Yura Lazovsky (Dancer). Works by: Glinka, Tchaikovsky, Brahms, Bach, Beethoven, Rachmaninoff, Glinka, Glinka, Glinka, Glinka, Rimsky-Korsakov, Weber, Nabokov, Rimsky-Korsakov, Gliere [Glière], Tchaikovsky, Shostakovich, and Rimsky-Korsakov. Notes: Fortune Gallo presents "Leonide Massine's Ballet Russe Highlights"
Many names of works unknown (only name of dance listed in program), chroeography was as follows:

Nutcracker: choreography by M. Petipa
Brahms: listed in program as "Bohemian dance", new choreography by Massine
Bach: new choreography by Massine
Beethoven: Contredanses listed in program as "Military; Chinese; Shepherdess; Rope dance". Assumed to be names of the dances, not the works. New choreography by Massine
Rachmaninoff: New choreography by Massine.
Glinka (Premiere Polka, Polish Festival): New choreography by Massine
Le Coq: listed in program as "Procession".
Weber: Ballet. Choreography by M. Fokine.
Nabokoff: Ballet. Choreography by Massine
Bumble Bee: New Choreography by Massine
Gliere: listed in program as "Russian Dance", New choreography by Massine.
Bluebird: Choreography by M. Petipa
Shostakovich: New Choreography by Massine (from review: "A heavey-handed comedy item")
Capriccio-Espagnole: Choreography by Massine. Alborada: orchestra; Scena e Canto Gitano: Baronova and Massine; Fandango Asturiano: all dancers.

oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: New York Philharmonic Leon Levy Digital Archives
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Soloists: Dinah Shore (Singer), and Treeter Freeman (Piano). Works by: Simon, Gershwin, Rose, Wright, Rodgers, Rodgers, Rodgers, Rodgers, Perez-Freire, Goodman, Arndt, Romberg, Rodgers, Goodman, Berlin, Ruiz, Porter, Gershwin, Kern, Gershwin, Kramer, Styne, Kern, Kern, Kern, Kern, and Unspecified. Notes: Concert originally scheduled for July 2; postponed due to rain. Encores taken from the NYT review.
"All Orchestra Arrangements by Al Goodman"

July 3 concert was originally to have been conducted by Smallens (Nicolai overture to Merry Wives of Windsor; Mosart Jupiter Symphony; Hadley In Bohemia overture, Saint-Saens Bacchanale; Tchaikovsky Andante cantabile from Quartet No. 1, Op. 11; Dukas Scherzo/Sorcerer's Apprentice), presumed cancelled.
